: integer. If present, the click event queue is not cleared when entering xclick.

DESCRIPTION.P: xclick waits for a mouse click in the graphics window.
If it is called with 3 left hand side arguments, it waits for a mouse click in the current graphics window.
If it is called with 4 or 5 left hand side arguments, it waits for a mouse click in any graphics window.
The returned values are described below.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: c_i
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : an integer which gives the number of the mouse button that was pressed 0, 1 or 2 (for left, middle and right) or -1 in case of problems with xclick.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: c_x,c_y
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : the coordinates of the position of the mouse click in the current graphics scale.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: c_w
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : the window number where the click has occurred.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: c_m
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : string associated with a dynamic menu. If xclick returns due to a click on a menu, c_i, c_x, c_y, and c_w take arbitrary values.

SECTION.label: Known troubles
SECTION.P: xclick can return the message "Can't grab the pointer" if the graphics window is iconified when calling it.
